annotation: In the provided meme, there is an image depicting Donald Trump standing next to Barack Obama at what appears to be an inauguration event, with other figures present in the background. The text overlaying the image reads, "WHEN YOU SEE THE GUY WHO SAID 'YOU'LL NEVER BE PRESIDENT' AT YOUR INAUGURATION". This text employs a humorous tone to depict a moment where Trump might feel triumphant over doubters, particularly Obama, who once expressed disbelief in Trump's ability to become president. The underlying message is a satirical take on overcoming skepticism and achieving unexpected success. The juxtaposition of the two figures highlights a contrast in expectations versus reality. The meme uses this imagery and context to provoke a humorous response by playing on themes of rivalry and political drama. Ultimately, the meme seeks to entertain while subtly commenting on political dynamics and personalities.

The meme emphasizes the differences between Pat Tillman and Colin Kaepernick. It contains the text: "There is no comparison between pat tillman and colin kaepernick" and the image of Pat Tillman in army uniform. Collin Kaepernick was an NFL player who lost his job due to protesting the National Anthem. Pat Tillman was an NFL player who left his football career to join the military, and is considered a hero. Critics of Kaepernick believe that his protests were disrespectful to the military, and mock those comparing the two for their sacrifices. The meme emphaizes the difference in protesting by Pat Tillman and Colin Kaepernick. The meme degrades Colin Kaepernick as he was protesting the honor of the Nation, while Pat Tillman protested to join the military and fight for his nation, therefore these are different kinds of protests. The meme also take a positive tone toward Pat Tillman by portraying him as a war hero and his sacrifice was noble unlike Colin.

This meme mocks AOC. The image contains the text: "Make AOC Bartend Again" and the image of a man wearing a red cap with the text. AOC was a former bartender who became an outspoken politician and many people question if her background makes her unfit to be a politician. Make America Great Again is a slogan used by Trump's presidential campaign. The meme creates a parallel between the popular Trump campaign slogan and the the text displayed on the meme. By doing so, the meme creates a satirical comment toward AOC and her background, indicating that she is unfit to be a politician, a view held by many republican Trump supporters, who are portrayed by the red cap which is common among Trump supporters.

The meme is attacking Democratic Minneapolis Mayor Jacob Frey.

The meme features a photo of its target, Jacob Frey. The caption begins, "The mayor of Minneapolis wants 55 million dollars for damages caused by riots." This refers to Black Lives Matter (BLM) protests in Minneapolis that escalated into violent riots, resulting in excessive property damage.

The core message is in the exclamation that follows the first sentence: "I don't think he should get a penny!" The text expresses discontent because Frey did not call in law enforcement to stop the riots. This is likely because, as Democrat, Mayor Frey supports BLM. As such, the meme is implying that it is his fault that Minneapolis suffered damage, and so his hypocritical request for money should be denied. The exclamation mark at the end of the meme's claim emphasizes the vehement tone in the refusal of Frey's request.

A final question concludes the caption: "Do you agree?" Though it is structured as a question, it encourages the audience to agree that Frey "should not get a penny" of his 55 million dollar request.

Given the disapproval of Mayor Frey, the final message is a criticism of his behavior: Jacob Frey is an inept and hypocritical mayor.

The meme is mainly praising Republican president Donald Trump, though it is also attacking ANTIFA.

The meme features a photo of Donald Trump, seated at his desk in the Oval Office. His expression conveys a serious and unhumorous tone.

The caption beneath Trump begins, "President Trump says he will designate ANTIFA as a terrorist group." This refers to how, though ANTIFA is a left-wing anti-fascism and anti-racism group, many of their protests and actions escalate into violence and riots. Right-leaning Republicans like Trump often view ANTIFA as a radical far-left violent group. Given the sincerity of the tone, the meme must be agreeing with and praising Trump for labeling ANTIFA as a terrorist group.

The second sentence asks, "Do you agree with him?" Though this is a question, it actually encourages the audience to agree with meme's message, namely, that ANTIFA is a terrorist group and Trump is doing a good job antagonizing them.

The meme is belittling Democrat Speaker of the House Nancy Pelosi but also showing support for former Republican president Donald Trump.

The meme features a fully-body photo of Donald Trump, standing and giving two thumbs up. Notably, though he is on the heavier side, Trump is not excessively overweight.

The caption begins, "Nancy think this is morbidly obese," where "this" refers to Trump's body. Speaker Nancy Pelosi likely made this claim due to her opposition towards Trump and desire to deface him. However, since morbid obesity is commonly associated with visible rolls of fat and an inability to stand, Trump must not be morbidly obese. Thus, the meme discounts Pelosi's claim, and this negative stance gives off a serious tone to the meme's message.

Finally, the meme extends a question to the audience: "What do you think?" This is actually intended to encourage the audience to also discount Pelosi, implying that Trump is most certainly not obese. This portrays Pelosi as ridiculous for thinking Trump is morbidly obese.

Given these portrayals, the overall message of the meme must be that Trump is not overweight and Pelosi is crazy for thinking he is.

The meme is ridiculing former Democratic president Barack Obama.

The text is split into two captions. The top caption asks, "When did America stop being great?" There is a notable assumption that America has become worse.

The meme then answers its question with its bottom caption: "When this clown was elected twice!" The "clown" refers to the photo of Barack Obama smiling. He is edited to be dressed in a colorful suit, and he has a frizzy red hairstyle, much like a clown. The depiction is meant to ridicule him, adding slight humor to the meme.

The words "elected twice" refer to Obama's two consecutive terms as president. The implication is that America has "stopped being great" since Obama's election. In other words, Obama's "clown-like" behavior has made America worse.

The structure of the sentences and the clown portrayal indicate a joke. The exclamation of the second sentence seems to be a punchline that mocks Obama. As such, the tone of the meme is overall set to be humorous with a backhanded aggression. The final message of the meme is the punchline: Obama made America worse when he was president.

The meme is mocking Democratic Speaker of the House Nancy Pelosi.The meme features an extremely close-up on Nancy Pelosi's face. The caption at the top of the meme labels her as a "78 year old virus." Specifically, since Pelosi is the U.S. Speaker of the House, she is a "virus," or detriment, to America. The additional mention that she is 78 years old mocks her age, which is accentuated by the wrinkles show on her photo.The caption at the bottom reads similar to a punchline of joke: "still no cure!" It humorously implies that there is no way to stop Pelosi from harming America.The intention of comparing Pelosi to an uncurable virus is to reference the COVID-19 pandemic around 2020, which occurred simultaneously with Pelosi's time as Speaker. The idea, and overall message, is that, similar to how COVID was an uncurable virus that plagued the world, Pelosi is an "uncurable virus" that plagues America.

The meme is praising former Republican president Donald Trump.

There is a photo of Trump boarding a government aircraft. There may be some hint of patriotism given by the image due to the words "States of America," in full capital letters, written on the aircraft.

The core meaning of the meme can be extracted from the caption beneath the image: "Used to think Trump was great but now seeing the whole system was rigged against him, I have to believe now that he is one of the greatest of all time!" The "rigged system" is a reference to the heavy opposition Trump has received since his announcement of presidential candidacy. His supporters believe that the political systems in America are trying to obstruct Trump, as he poses a threat to their control over America.

According to the caption, then, Trump was "great" but is now "the greatest of all time" because he is fighting the heavy opposition of a "rigged system." The added context also indicates that the image intends to depict Trump as a hard worker who is always on flights around America. The genuine praise and reference to the heavy topic of a "rigged system" add a serious and unhumorous overall tone to the meme.

Since there is no humor, the meme's praise of Trump is its message: Donald Trump is the greatest president in history.

This meme praises Trump while mocking Obama. The meme contains the text: "We went from the worst president ever to the best president ever. Who agrees?" and the image of Obama to the left and Trump to the right. The image portrays Obama as clueless while Trump is strong.Trump served as president after Obama. Obama, Democrat, was president from 2008-2016. Trump, Republican, was president from 2016-2020. The text indicates that Obama was the worst president and Trump was the best president, this tone is further enhanced by the images as it shows Trump as a more confident and strong leader, a positive trait for leaders, while Obama as a weaker president who is unsure, a negative trait for leaders.

The meme is insulting liberals.

The caption on the meme begins, "Hey everyone check out cokehead Neil Terell." This text references the image beneath featuring Terell, snorting cocaine through a rolled up dollar bill. Given the negative connotation of "cokehead," the introduction using "Hey everyone" is intended to be demeaning towards Neil Terell. Accordingly, this introduces an aggressive tone.

The caption then continues, "Perfect example of the washed up broke liberal." Here, the meme is using elements of the image typical of low-income individuals to label Terell as "broke." Mainly, drug usage is stereotypical of low income individuals. However, additional elements include the cheap attire Terell is dressed in, as well as the cheap clothing of the woman in the background of the image. This negative imagery further compounds the aggression the meme exudes.

Labelling Terell as a liberal highlights how liberals support the decriminalization of drugs. As such, it follows that a drug user would be a liberal. Using this association, the meme generalizes the insults about Terell to all liberals, setting him as an "example of the washed up broke liberal." In other words, liberals are poor and addicted to drugs.

The meme mocks the FBI. It contains the text: "Hope you had fun investigating me now it's my turn" and the image of Trump smirking.Trump was impeached on charges regarding abuse of power during his presidential term. Trump used the slogan "drain the swamp" during his presidential campaign, which was used to convey that he would eliminate corruption in politics. The meme suggests that Trump is the one investigating now, and will investigate politicians and departments to eliminate all corruption. This mocks the FBI as the text indicates that Trump will now investigate the FBI and fire many of the officers that investigated him.

This meme mocks Adam Schiff. It contains the text: "If you would like to see Adam Schiff tried for treason, give a yuge thumbs up" and the image of Adam Schiff. Congressman Adam Schiff represents California's 30th Congressional District. Donald Trump suggested that Adam Schiff be tried for treason. The meme mocks Adam Schiff as he was in charge of the House Intelligence committee when t investigated the impeachment of Trump, now Donald Trump as threatened to try Adam Schiff for treason.

This meme mocks the protestors protesting Trump. It contains the text: "impeach trump before we all end up with jobs!" and the image of a group of people protesting. Unemployment is a indicator of the health of the economy. Donald Trump was known for reducing unemployment during his presidential term. The meme mocks the protestors by indicating that their motives are to not get jobs and keep the unemployment up. Therefore, the meme suggests that these protests are lack of logic and actually indicate President Trumps success.

The meme calls to action to support Trump. The meme contains the text: "Election is only 6 months way! Thumbs up for Trump and Thumbs down for Biden!" and the image of Trump and Biden.Biden and Trump are presidential candidates and opponents. Thumbs up is used to show support. Thumbs down is used to show opposition. Trump and Biden both ran for presidential election in 2020. The meme suggests its support for Trump and opposition for Biden, by indicating a thumbs up for Trump, showing support, and a thumbs down for Biden, showing opposition.

The meme mocks Congress. It contains the text: I still don't understand how a man who's never held public office until elected president is blamed for all of America's problems‚ By the people we've had in Congress since the 1970's" and the image of Trump shrugging. Trump is famously known for not being a politician prior to becoming president. Trump was elected president in 2016. the meme suggests that congress blames Trump for most of America's serious problems, however, the meme points out that Trump had never held office before becoming president, therefore he couldn't possibly be the reason of all the problems in America as these problems track beyond the scope of Trump's service.

The meme mocks Nanci Pelosi. The meme contains the text: "We the people want this woman out of office" and the image of Nanci Pelosi. Nancy Pelosi is the former Speaker of the House
"We the People" is the beginning of the preamble of the United States constitution, which establishes that the country is governed democratically by the will of the people.
People do not like Nancy Pelosi for her bias towards Trump. The meme mocks Nanci Pelosi by creating a parallel with the constitution to indicate popular support of the idea that Nanci Pelosi must be removed from office.

This meme mocks Joe Biden. It contains the text: "knock knock who's there? Who's where?" and the image of Trump and Biden in a knock knock joke but the punch line being Biden being clueless.Joe Biden saying "Knock knock". Donald Trump saying "Who's there?". "Joe Biden saying "Who's where?"
Knock knock jokes are a common joke format consisting of two people. One person says "knock knock" and the other person says "who's there?" and the first person responds with a name or phrase that is a pun on the word "who".
Biden is the oldest president in history.
People are concerned that with Biden's old age that he might have some mental issues that make him incapable of being president. The meme mocks Biden by suggesting that he is incapable of office by showing his as clueless to a common easily understood knock knock joke.

The meme shows support of Trump. The meme contains the text: "I picked you for president" and the image of Jesus supporting Trump for president.Christians view Jesus as omnibenevolent and omnipotent.
Trump was elected president in 2016.
some people view Trump as a prophet and that his word is right always. The meme suggests that Jesus picked Trump for President, therefore, the people must vote him in and follow Jesus as he is a prophet and always knows whats right.

The meme mocks people who wear masks during the COVID 19 pandemic. It contains the text: "Which one are you? Choose wisely before they choose for you" and the image of a sheep wearing a mask and a wolf. The sheep represents people who wear masks while wolves represent people who don't. Calling someone a sheep is an insult that implies that they are stupid and easily manipulated.
Calling someone a wolf is a compliment that implies that they are strong and independent.The COVID-19 pandemic is a global pandemic that has killed millions of people. COVID prevention measures include wearing masks and social distancing.
Many conspiracy theorists believe that the COVID-19 pandemic is a hoax, and that prevention measures are used by a global elite to control people. The meme suggests that choosing to wear masks is a sign of weakness and being manipulated while people who don't wear masks are associated with wolves who don't succumb to manipulation.

The meme suggests a correlation between a terrorist attack and Hilary Clinton. It contains the text: "Reminder: This building in Oklahoma City was blown up and destroyed 4 days before Hillary Clinton was to be indicted in the Whitewater scandal. All documents lost!" and the image of a building being blown up.Federal buildings are often used to store important government documents.
Documents are often used as evidence in court cases.
The Whitewater Scandal was an investigation into the Clinton's real estate investments.
The Oklahoma City Bombings were a federal building. The meme suggests that the coincidence is too unlikely and that the bombings were planned by the Clintons as it resulting in the loss of incriminating evidence against them.

The meme mocks people who take vaccines. IT contains the text: "how to vaccinate cattle how to vaccinate, ahem test, the herd" and the image of Cattle being vaccinated and the image of a lady being tested for COVID-19. Calling people a "herd" means they are easily controlled.
Some people believe that COVID vaccines are actually tests conducted on the public. The meme mocks the people who take vaccines by comparing them to cattle who are tested for research purposes, therefore demeaning them as being tested on like cattle is demeaning.

The meme emphasizes a certain negative viewpoint against the BLM movement. The image in the meme portrays President Trump in the scene of a destroyed building. Trump was the president of the United States
The Black Lives Matter protests in 2020 sometimes resulted in violence, including the robbery of stores in the areas where protests were happening.there have been violent BLM protests in America against America's systemic oppression.
American soldiers fought overseas against oppressive governments. The meme suggests that the sacrifices of many soldiers abroad to protect peace was meaningless as their ideals were trampled upon with violence inside the nation, therefore casting the BLM movement as the opposition.

The meme accuses the Democrat party of corruption.

The meme features a photo of Democrat House Majority Whip James Clyburn and Speaker of the House Nancy Pelosi. While this adds no tone or expression to the meme, it highlights the meme's target of accusation: Democrats.

The text is split into two captions, adding a dramatic pause to its expression and intensifying the message. The top caption begins, "House majority whip James Clyburn, gave it away with one comment," implying that Clyburn, and by extension, the Democratic Party, are hiding a secret.

The bottom caption describes the comment: "COVID-19 'is a tremendous opportunity to restructure things to fit our vision.'" This indicates that Democrats are using the COVID-19 pandemic, a cause of death and chaos to the world, as an "opportunity to restructure" the political environment to "fit their vision." The "vision" is implied to be some situation which prevents opposition to the Democratic Party, particular from Republicans. This quote from Clyburn paints Democrats as morally bankrupt because they are capitalizing on suffering to improve their party's standing.

It is implied that the Democrats are trying to appear morally upstanding, but this secret that Clyburn "gave away" revealed their true sinister nature. Thus the meme's message alleges that the Democratic Party is corrupt.

The meme is making fun of the clothing company Nike, the National Football League (NFL), and Black Lives Matter (BLM).

The meme features two cops laughing hard at each other. The laughter in the image alone already evokes feelings of humor.

It seems the cops are laughing because of a humorous story one of them told. He begins, "Nike called and said they were being looted by Black Lives Matter." This references two things: (1) Nike endorses BLM and (2) BLM protests often escalate into looting. As such, this text highlights an ironic situation in which company that supports BLM was getting robbed and requesting the help of law enforcement. However, BLM is notoriously at odds with police enforcement, as they claim that police brutality primarily targets black people due to prejudice among the police force. Some also openly advocate to defund the police.

As such, the cop capitalized on the irony to joke, "I told them to call the NFL for help!" Again, the exclamation mark at the end of the sentence highlights the humorous tone. What the cop implies is that, since Nike supports BLM, they inherently support defunding the police. Thus, they do not deserve the help of police officers and are instead redirected to ask the NFL for help, as they are another company that endorses BLM.

It is clear then, that the irony and humor is intended to mock the NFL and Nike for getting robbed by the BLM movement they support. An implicit accusation is also present, namely, that BLM encourages theft.

The meme is calling out hypocrisy in the Democratic Party.

The caption claims that "The party that constantly calls the right racist and sexist just chose their VP based on race and sex." The "party" being reference is the Democratic political party, the logo of which, a blue letter D, is present in the image. The caption is a reference to how the Democratic party designates itself as the party of tolerance and diversity. Their platform revolves around supporting marginalized groups to provide an equal opportunity to all, irrespective of race or gender. As such, the opposing Republican party is portrayed as racist and sexist when they oppose these Democratic policies.

The "VP" (vice president) in question is featured in the image. Democratic Vice President Kamala Harris is shown standing next to President Joe Biden. An important note of the 2020 presidential election is that Biden vowed to pick a woman as his vice president. The meme's accusation is that choosing a black woman as a vice president was intended to appeal to voters who desired the representation of marginalized groups. However, in focusing their selection of their VP "based on race and sex," specifically black women, the Democratic party has committed a hypocrisy, as they are preventing equal opportunity for any other race or sex.

This accusation gives off a negative and serious tone, accentuated by the lack of humorous elements. As such, the meme's message is that the Democratic Party is hypocritical and not truly diverse or tolerant.

The meme is criticizing gun control.

The text is split into two captions. Above, the meme poses a question: "What does a government do once it has disarmed its citizens?" This refers to how gun control advocates for "disarming" citizens of their firearms, as they are deadly and promote violence.

The meme, however, rebuts gun control arguments by answer its question with its bottom caption: "Whatever it wants." This implies that citizens without weapons cannot defend themselves against their government, and so they are free to do "whatever they want." This is a common gun advocating argument, which especially highlights the historical purpose of the Second Amendment (right to bear arms) in the Bill of Rights, designed to protect people from powerful government.

To highlight the threat of a government unchecked by its people, the meme features an image of Fidel Castro, smiling and smoking on a cigar. Castro was the communist dictator of Cuba who ruled oppressively. His depiction and smile is meant to highlight the evil and oppression that these unchecked governments are capable of, and presumably, what will eventually occur.

The fear of this threat sets an overall serious tone, despite Castro's smile. His expression instead highlights a danger in giving power to governments. Thus, the meme advocates for gun ownership and criticizes gun control.

The meme is mocking Bill Gates and COVID-19.

The text is split into two captions for comedic effect. At the top, it begins, "That look you get when your billion dollar virus." The "look" the meme is referring to is the photo of Bill Gates, frowning and closing his eyes in dismay. His expression looked exaggerated, adding a humorous effect. Additionally, the use of Bill Gates indicates that "your billion dollar virus" refers to a conspiracy that Gates funded the creation of the coronavirus to harm people.

The meme finishes its thought with a punchline at the bottom: "has a $20 cure." This implies that COVID-19, the expensive "billion dollar virus," has a cheap cure, and as such, the money put into the virus has gone to waste. Accordingly, Bill Gates is feeling disappointed that he has wasted his money. This joke intends to make fun of Bill Gates' his silly expression and wasted efforts.

Thus, this meme has two messages: (1) Bill Gates created COVID-19 and (2) he wasted his money because it is easy to cure.

The meme is criticizing Twitter and Facebook censorship policies.

The text is split into two captions. Above, it begins "If we were really wrong about them." Then, the meme displays a picture of a woman winking and smiling smugly. She is sipping from a wine glass, and wearing a party hat. Party balloons and streamers fill the background. The lighthearted and smug aura from this image indicates the humor in the tone of the meme, and it also gives slight indication as to the meme's standpoint.

The bottom caption then concludes the proposition, "they wouldn't need to censor us." The implication is that claims that are blatantly wrong do not need to be censored. Therefore, the "we" referred to in the text is not really wrong about "them."

The use of the idea of "censoring wrong" people identifies "we" and "them." Certain social media platforms, particularly, Twitter and Facebook, were accused of censoring voices on their sites. While their goal was to eliminate misinformation, conservatives believed it was a ploy to silence them and portray them as disseminators of misinformation. Given this context, "we" must be those conservative voices, and "they" must be Facebook and Twitter. However, "they" can be further extended to represent liberals, as it is believed the targeted censorship of conservatives originates from a liberal scheme to obstruct opposition.

Thus, the expression on the woman's face is used to affirm that conservative voice are being proven to be truthful because Facebook and Twitter are censoring them. The sense of smugness and humor stems from the irony in this meme. Facebook and Twitter's censorship policies are aimed to portray conservatives as misinformation spreaders; however, by aggressively censoring them, these media platforms are implicitly admitting that conservatives are right and their words are a threat to Facebook, Twitter, and liberals.

Thus, the message of the meme is twofold: it (1) celebrates conservative voices on the internet for being truthful and (2) makes fun of Twitter and Facebook for helping prove these conservative voices correct, even though they were trying to silence them.

The meme doubts the effectiveness of the COVID-19 pandemic lockdown.

The meme is split into two panels. The top panel features former Chief Medical Advisor Dr. Anthony Fauci, giving a speech. He claims, "Lockdown is the only way to keep you safe." This refers to the COVID-19 pandemic response. Fauci advised people to stay indoors in a lockdown to prevent the spread of COVID.

The lower panel, however, doubts Fauci's claim. It features Jeffery Epstein, smirking with his head tilted, as though in doubt. He is rebutting Fauci's claim with a curt reply: "Really?". This implies that Fauci is incorrect about the lockdown's effectiveness. He might even possibly be lying for some ulterior motive. Such an accusation lends a heavy mood and serious tone. However, Epstein's curt reply adds an grim but humorous aspect in doubting Fauci's platform.

The use of Epstein may highlight the meme's belief in this accusation against Fauci. Epstein died in prison, and there is a conspiracy that Epstein was murdered to silence him. Factoring this conspiracy in, the meme draws parallels from Epstein's death while locked up in prison to indicate that the COVID-19 lockdown, which similar confines people to small spaces, is endangering the public. Thus, Fauci's ulterior motive may be to harm people by locking them up.

Given this accusation of Fauci and reference to Epstein, the message of the meme is that the COVID-19 lockdown is not particularly safe and may even be dangerous.

The meme is mocking Democratic president Joe Biden.

The meme features a picture of musician Ozzy Osbourne. Notably, Osbourne is notorious drug addict.

The text then uses Osbourne to mock Biden. The caption is split into two sections for comedic effect, conveying a humorous tone. At the top above the image of Osbourne, the caption begins, "still more coherent," in reference the delirium that Osbourne experiences when using drugs.

The bottom caption delivers the punchline: "than Joe Biden." In other words, Joe Biden is less coherent than a drug addict. This is in reference to Joe Biden's many gaffes and slip-ups caught on video. Many people suspect that Joe Biden's age has declined his mental capability. Thus, the meme is making fun of Biden for being so senile that he is less mentally capable than someone on drugs.

However, the meme specifically makes this joke in reference to Biden's presidency: He lacks the mental capacity to be President of the United States.

The meme is praising Republican President Donald Trump and criticizing Democrats for their treatment of Hispanics.

The meme is split into two panels to intensify the delivery of the meme's message. Above, the caption reads "On the same day President Trump expanded education and economic opportunities to Hispanics...", pointing towards the photo Trump smiling and holding a document in his hand. He is being applauded, and presumably, this is Trump in the act of "expanding education and economic opportunities to Hispanics." This is especially praiseworthy given the rough situations of many Hispanics in America, and the applause in the image encourages the audience to also praise Trump's virtue.

The lower panel compares the actions of the left and its representative Democrats. Its caption completes the trailing thought from the text above: "The left launched a boycott against a Hispanic-owned family business for supporting Trump." The image clarifies which company the meme is referring to. It features photo of two men, one of the whom is Robert Unanue, the CEO of Goya Foods, standing in front a GOYA Foods building. This must be the "Hispanic-owned family business," as Unanue publicly endorsed Trump.

Thus, the left is being negatively depicted for boycotting a Hispanic business. The implication is that they are discriminating against their race, which adds an unhumorous and negative tone to the meme. On the other hand, Trump is giving positive opportunities for Hispanics.

There is additional irony in the comparison, however. The Democrats generally represent the party of racial diversity and tolerance, especially towards marginalized and struggling populations like Hispanics in America. Meanwhile, the Republicans are generally depicted as disliking Hispanics, because they oppose illegal immigration and believe that Hispanics are illegally entering America.

Since the Democrats are targeting and boycotting a Hispanic business, there is a highlighted hypocrisy in their actions. Meanwhile Trump's praiseworthy actions are intended to dispel the belief that Republicans dislike the Hispanic population.

The overall message, then, is twofold, though the negative focuses its message on the Democrats. First, Donald Trump is a good president who helps marginalized groups. Second (the meme's focus), Democrats are hypocrites who only appear tolerant when it benefits them.

The meme is both praising former Republican president Donald Trump and also attacking the Democrats who opposed him.

The meme features a photo of Donald Trump. He is walking, and has a rather serious expression which entails a serious tone to the meme.

The captions are bulleted list, describing the things Trump has said. They use a parallel structure, each beginning with "He told us" or "He warned us," which serves to strengthen the message behind each point and further build a serious tone.

First, "He told us to protect our borders," referring to Trump's anti-immigration stance.

Second, "He told us to bring manufacturing back home," referring to Trump's focus on returning outsourced manufacturing to American facilities.

Third, "He told us to be less dependent on other countries," which, like the previous point, references Trump's emphasis on an economically self-sufficient America.

Fourth, "He warned us about China," referring to Trump's opposition of China, particularly as an economic superpower and competitor to America.

The final, fifth point instead attacks Democrats, solidifying the meme's positive stance on Trump and his policies. It reads "Democrats fought him every step of the way!", in reference to the staunch opposition Trump received during his presidency. The exclamation highlights the meme's dislike that Democrats are trying to stop Trump. The implication is that Trump's policies have improved America, but Democrats are stopping him, presumably because of some ulterior and corrupt motive.

As such, the overall message is: (1) Trump is a good president and (2) Democrats are corrupt.

The meme is attacking Democrat Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer.

The text is split into captions, to factor in the meme's image, for an intensified message. The top caption begins, "As a taxpayer and citizen of this country, I do hereby demand." Notably, the use of the formal speech pattern "do hereby demand" sets a intense and serious tone.

Cutting off the text, the picture is of a dark swirling storm cloud. In its center, a single light bolt is striking the ground. The meme evokes lightning's powerful, bright flashes and the loud crackling of thunder to add an aggressive tone to meme, as though the meme's "demand" is so intense and powerful that lightning crackled forth the indicate its gravity.

The bottom caption clarifies the meme's "demand," which is the overall message. It reads, " the arrest and conviction of senator Chuck Schumer for his threats to the supreme court!" The exclamation similarly amplifies the sincerity and aggression.

The "threats" which the text refers to are some negative remarks from Schumer towards two Supreme Court justices, following the overturning of Roe v. Wade. The meme is implying that this sort of behavior is not just unacceptable, but also criminal. As such, the meme advocates for the "arrest and conviction" of Chuck Schumer.

The meme makes a pun. It contains the image of Nanci Pelosi smirking and Donald Trump grinning. The meme also contains the text: "we weren't notified before the attack on soleimani neither was he." Nancy Pelosi is the Speaker of the House of Representatives and a opponent of Trump.
Qassem Soleimani was considered an enemy of the United States. In 2020, an airstrike was launched to attack Iranian General Qassem Soleimani. Soleimani was killed in the attack. The meme creates a pun here by stating that Nanci Pelosi who represents the Democrats, weren't notified of the attack on Soleimani; however, Trump also indicates that Soleimani was also not notified. This creates a satirical comment by emphasizing the secrecy o the attack to improve it's probability of success.

This meme provides an alternate viewpoint of the situation regarding Trump and Biden and their affiliates. The meme is supporting former Republican U.S. president Donald Trump for attacking Democrat House Representative Ilhan Omar.

There are two photos, for each of the targets of the message. On the left is Donald Trump, and on the right is Ilhan Omar. Trump is talking, with an irritated expression, adding an aggression to the tone. Omar looks somewhat serious, and slightly saddened, giving a serious tone.

The text below poses the meme's message as a question. It asks, "Do you agree with President Trump when he told Ilhan Omar she could get out of America and said, 'You can't leave fast enough.'" The meme emphasizes and supports Trump's words by highlighting the words "get out" and "You can't leave fast enough" in yellow. Furthermore, "get out" is fully capitalized. Thus, the text must be demanding Omar to leave America, mainly to leave her office as Congresswoman.

The particular messaging about "getting out" may be in reference to Omar's actions and past. First, she is Muslim, as can also be noted by the hijab she is wearing in the image. Second, she was not born in America, but rather fled from Somalia to the U.S. Finally, third, some of Omar's comments on social media were considered anti-Semitic.

Thus, people have used her religion, foreign origin, and aggressive nature to label her as a stereotypical Middle Eastern terrorist. As such, the meme echoes these beliefs. It uses Trump as an authority figure to empower the message, and aggressively demands the exile of Omar both from her political office and America.

The meme is mocking opposition to former Republican president Donald Trump.

The text highlights a hypocrisy. It begins, "Remember that the same people who told you Trump would start a nuclear war...", trailing off to add a hint of tension to the tone of the text. It imperatively asks the audience to recall a certain kind of "people," namely, Trump haters, who had feared that Trump would incite a nuclear war.

Thus, Trump haters must all-out warfare. The text uses this reasoning to attack Trump haters. Starting from where the text trailed off, it continues, "are now the same people upset over peace." Trump haters are depicted as being "upset over peace," presumably because Trump is responsible for said peace. The text emphasizes this contradictory logic by reminding the audience that the "same people" who opposed war out of fear for Trump are also the "same people" who are angered at peace caused by Trump. The word "peace" is also highlighted in yellow to emphasize how ridiculous and twisted it is to oppose peace. The implication is that Trump haters are so focused on opposing Trump that they would oppose the good things he does as well.

The meme takes on a mocking stance in its message, as evident from the picture of Trump smiling with his eyes shut, nearly laughing. The humor drawn from his face depicts the text as joke, that first introduces a topic, trails off, then delivers a punchline. Thus, factoring in this humorous tone, the meme's message is to ridicule Trump haters for being so illogical.
